When reason is awakening, the mind is most susceptible, and so the very first lessons are of great importance. 

294 

These lessons have a powerful influence in the formation of character. If they are of the right stamp, and if, as the child advances in years, they are followed up with patient perseverance, the earthly and the eternal destiny will be shaped for good. This is the word of the Lord: "Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it" (Proverbs 22:6). --SpTEd 71, c1897. (CT 143.)
